abstract: British Petroleum has frozen payments of more than 1.5 million pounds ($3 million) owed to its former chief executive, John Browne. Mr. Browne was forced to resign earlier this year and BP has decided to withhold the money until a court case, brought by a group of shareholders in Alaska, is resolved.
